title: Slayer task/Green dragons

properties.name: description
properties.value:
Green dragons can be assigned as a slayer task at level 52 combat by Vannaka and Krystilia after partial completion of Dragon Slayer I.
Green dragons are most commonly found in the Wilderness, but other variants can be found in other places as well. They attack with melee and dragonfire, thus some protection against it should be considered (the brutal green dragon also uses magic). Due to their large size, they are usually able to be safespotted with ranged or halberd-like weapons. As dragons they are also weak to dragonbane weapons.

Green dragons

Krystilia60-100

Advanced data
Icon IDNo

Green dragons can be assigned as a slayer task at level 52 combat by Vannaka and Krystilia after partial completion of Dragon Slayer I. Green dragons are most commonly found in the Wilderness, but other variants can be found in other places as well. They attack with melee and dragonfire, thus some protection against it should be considered (the brutal green dragon also uses magic). Due to their large size, they are usually able to be safespotted with ranged or halberd-like weapons. As dragons they are also weak to dragonbane weapons.

Monster Variants[edit | edit source]

Monster Combat level Slayer XP Locations Notes
Baby green dragon 48 50
  • Brimhaven Dungeon
  • Corsair Cove Dungeon
  • Weakest variant of green dragons. Drops only baby dragon bones, but does not use dragonfire. Requires an axe to access Brimhaven Dungeon, or completion of Dragon Slayer II to access the Corsair Cove Dungeon.
Green dragon 79 75
  • Wilderness
  • Corsair Cove Dungeon
  • The standard version of green dragon. The Corsair Cove Dungeon, which is the only place where they can be found outside the Wilderness, requires completion of Dragon Slayer II to access.
Elvarg 83 80
  • Crandor and Karamja Dungeon
  • Nightmare Zone
  • A boss monster fought during Dragon Slayer I. Elvarg can be safely slain again in the Nightmare Zone following completion of the quest. Drops only Dragon bones in the Nightmare Zone.
Green dragon 88 100
  • Wilderness Slayer Cave
  • A slightly higher-level variant. Only found in the Wilderness Slayer Cave in the Wilderness.
Brutal green dragon 227 183
  • Ancient Cavern
  • A particularly strong variant of green dragon with an additional magic attack. Requires partial completion of Barbarian Training to access the Ancient Cavern.

Location Comparison[edit | edit source]

 This article is currently in the middle of an expansion or major revamping.
The information contained within it should not be considered fully accurate and/or complete. You can help by contributing to it.
Location Maplink Amount Multicombat Cannonable Safespotable Notes
Wilderness (West of Dark Warriors' Fortress) 3 normal dragons No Yes No
  • In the Wilderness.
Wilderness (South of Venenatis) 11 normal dragons No Yes Yes
  • In the Wilderness. Largest concentration of green dragons.
Wilderness (North of Graveyard of Shadows) 5 normal dragons Unknown Unknown Unknown
  • In the Wilderness. Close to Ferox Enclave.
Wilderness (South of Lava Maze) 5 normal dragons Unknown Yes Unknown
  • In the Wilderness.
Wilderness Slayer Cave 6 normal dragons Yes Yes Yes
  • Only places where the level-88 variant is found. In the Wilderness.
Corsair Cove Dungeon 2 normal dragons, 1 baby dragon Unknown Unknown Unknown
  • Requires completion of Dragon Slayer II
Brimhaven Dungeon 11 baby dragons No No Yes
  • Baby green dragons.
Ancient Cavern 7 brutal dragons No No No
  • Brutal green dragons. Requires partial completion of Barbarian Training to access.

Green dragons can be assigned as a [[slayer task]] at level 52 [[combat]] by [[Vannaka]] and [[Krystilia]] after partial completion of [[Dragon Slayer I]].
Green dragons are most commonly found in the [[Wilderness]], but other variants can be found in other places as well. They attack with [[melee]] and [[dragonfire]], thus some protection against it should be considered (the [[brutal green dragon]] also uses [[magic]]). Due to their large size, they are usually able to be [[safespot]]ted with [[ranged]] or [[halberd]]-like weapons. As dragons they are also weak to [[dragonbane]] weapons.
